intro: Aerva javanica var. bovei, commonly known as Bove's velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural areas. Its rapid growth and seed dispersal make it a common weed in many parts of the world.
